case.name: NBAN v Minister for Immigration and Multicultural Affairs [2006] FCA 57 (8 February 2006)

citation.tocase: VBAP of 2002 v Minister for Immigration and Multicultural and Indigenous Affairs [2005] FCA 965
citation.text:
6 The approach of North J in VBAP of 2002 v Minister for Immigration and Multicultural and Indigenous Affairs [2005] FCA 965 is apt. In circumstances where the Tribunal's decision is based on alternative reasons and grounds, relief would not issue. It is unnecessary to deal with an additional argument put by the Minister that even if relief would otherwise issue the Court should not grant it, as a matter of discretion.
I certify that the preceding six (6) numbered paragraphs are a true copy of the Reasons for Judgment herein of the Honourable Justice Moore.
Associate:
Dated: 15 February 2006
The Appellant appeared in person
Counsel for the Respondent: R A Pepper
Solicitor for the Respondent: Blake Dawson Waldron
Date of Hearing: 8 February 2006
Date of Judgment: 8 February 2006
